New Records: Olivier Giroud scored his 57th international goal, making him France's all-time leading marksman.
Key Match Events: France came back from being down 1-0 and 2-1 to win 3-2 against Chile.
Youssouf Fofana scored the equalizing goal for France.
Randal Kolo Muani scored a goal and assisted another for France.
Dario Osorio scored a late goal for Chile to make it 3-2.
Pre-Game Insights: France was left reeling after conceding an early goal to Germany in their previous game.
Chile was getting ready for the Copa America and was playing their second game under new coach Ricardo Gareca.
Post-Match Reflections: The result will ease some of the doubts that had surrounded the French team following their flat performance against Germany.
This was far from a first-choice French side, with only Kylian Mbappe and Aur√©lien Tchouameni retained in the starting line-up.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jonathan Clauss and Eduardo Camavinga were forced off injured in the first half for France.
France appeared at risk of losing consecutive games for the first time since June 2015.
Others: France will prepare for the European Championship in June and July.
Chile will face holders Argentina, Peru and Canada in the group phase of the Copa America.
